entry.title: Pashinyan says border delimitation is a matter of Armenia's existence

media:group.media:title: Pashinyan says border delimitation is a matter of Armenia's existence
media:group.media:description:
üìç Prime Minister Pashinyan says border delimitation is painful but must be done to secure the future of Armenia. üìç Armenia agrees to hold normalization talks with Azerbaijan in Kazakhstan. üìç U.S. State Department report on human rights practices says Armenian government faces significant issues, including credible reports of torture, arbitrary arrest, and the lack of an independent judiciary. üìç American companies are involved in feasibility studies for a new nuclear power plant in Armenia. WATCH MORE: Podcast with Kev Orkian https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=grDMxi-raik

media:group.media:title: Building a powerful Armenian identity
media:group.media:description:
Renowned British comedian Kev Orkian joins Patrick on the Civilnet podcast to share his insights as an Armenian in the Diaspora. They discuss the importance of remembering the Armenian Genocide and crafting a hopeful vision for the future. In a wide-ranging conversation, Orkian also offers his perspectives on cultivating Armenian pride, changing negative mindsets, and creating a compelling narrative to empower the nation.

entry.title: Azerbaijan re-asserts demand for a corridor through Armenia

media:group.media:title: Azerbaijan re-asserts demand for a corridor through Armenia
media:group.media:description:
üìç Armenia and the world commemorated the 109th anniversary of the Armenian Genocide. üìç Azerbaijan re-asserts its demand for a corridor through Armenia while the demarcation process threatens to interrupt a major road to Georgia. üìç Philanthropist Ruben Vardanyan moved to an isolation cell after going on hunger strike to protest his detainment. üìç WATCH MORE: Insights- Never Forget, Never Repeat: Commemorating the Armenian Genocide: https://youtu.be/7AOX5PnES_U

entry.title: Never Forget, Never Repeat: Commemorating the Armenian Genocide

media:group.media:title: Never Forget, Never Repeat: Commemorating the Armenian Genocide
media:group.media:description:
On this week's Insights, host Eric examines the upcoming departure of EU Special Representative Toivo Klaar from his role in the South Caucasus. He analyzes what led to this change and considers its potential implications. The episode also touches on the ongoing recognition efforts for the 109th anniversary of the Armenian Genocide, keeping alive observations on justice and remembrance of the past.
